title: Mult-Stage Separator Data Schema
description: A Multi-Stage Separator test mimics the processing of produced fluids through one or more stages of separation. Primarily for black-oil and volatile-oil fluid systems, the results of this test are formation volume factors and densities, shrinkages, API gravity, and producing GOR that are used both in reservoir engineering calculations and facilities design.

SamplesAnalysisID.title: Samples Analysis ID
SamplesAnalysisID.description: The OSDU Identifier for this SamplesAnalysis.

SampleID.title: Sample ID
SampleID.description: The OSDU Identifier for the Sample associated with this analysis.

Meta.title: Meta
Meta.description: A meta data item, which allows the association of named properties or property values to a Unit/Measurement/CRS/Azimuth/Time context.

items.title: Frame of Reference Meta Data Item
items.description: A meta data item, which allows the association of named properties or property values to a Unit/Measurement/CRS/Azimuth/Time context.

kind.title: UOM Reference Kind
kind.description: The kind of reference, 'Unit' for FrameOfReferenceUOM.

name.title: UOM Unit Symbol
name.description: The unit symbol or name of the unit.

persistableReference.title: UOM Persistable Reference
persistableReference.description: The self-contained, persistable reference string uniquely identifying the Unit.

unitOfMeasureID.description: SRN to unit of measure reference.

propertyNames.title: UOM Property Names
propertyNames.description: The list of property names, to which this meta data item provides Unit context to. A full path like "StructureA.PropertyB" is required to define a unique context; "data" is omitted since frame-of reference normalization only applies to the data block.

kind.title: CRS Reference Kind
kind.description: The kind of reference, constant 'CRS' for FrameOfReferenceCRS.

persistableReference.title: CRS Persistable Reference
persistableReference.description: The self-contained, persistable reference string uniquely identifying the CRS.

propertyNames.title: CRS Property Names
propertyNames.description: The list of property names, to which this meta data item provides CRS context to. A full path like "StructureA.PropertyB" is required to define a unique context; "data" is omitted since frame-of reference normalization only applies to the data block.

kind.title: DateTime Reference Kind
kind.description: The kind of reference, constant 'DateTime', for FrameOfReferenceDateTime.

name.title: DateTime Name
name.description: The name of the DateTime format and reference.

persistableReference.title: DateTime Persistable Reference
persistableReference.description: The self-contained, persistable reference string uniquely identifying DateTime reference.

propertyNames.title: DateTime Property Names
propertyNames.description: The list of property names, to which this meta data item provides DateTime context to. A full path like "StructureA.PropertyB" is required to define a unique context; "data" is omitted since frame-of reference normalization only applies to the data block.

kind.title: AzimuthReference Reference Kind
kind.description: The kind of reference, constant 'AzimuthReference', for FrameOfReferenceAzimuthReference.

name.title: AzimuthReference Name
name.description: The name of the CRS or the symbol/name of the unit.

persistableReference.title: AzimuthReference Persistable Reference
persistableReference.description: The self-contained, persistable reference string uniquely identifying AzimuthReference.

propertyNames.title: AzimuthReference Property Names
propertyNames.description: The list of property names, to which this meta data item provides AzimuthReference context to. A full path like "StructureA.PropertyB" is required to define a unique context; "data" is omitted since frame-of reference normalization only applies to the data block.

TestNumber.title: Test Number
TestNumber.description: The unique identifier for the multi-stage separator test, used to track and reference specific test results.

ReservoirTemperature.title: Reservoir Temperature
ReservoirTemperature.description: The temperature of the reservoir during the test, which affects fluid properties and separation outcomes.

SaturationPressure.title: Saturation Pressure
SaturationPressure.description: The pressure at which the fluid becomes saturated with gas, critical for determining phase behavior, as measured at reservoir temperature.

ReservoirPressure.title: Reservoir Pressure
ReservoirPressure.description: The pressure conditions of the reservoir where the sample was collected.

SaturatedOilFormationVolumeFactor.title: Saturated Oil Formation Volume Factor
SaturatedOilFormationVolumeFactor.description: The formation volume factor of the oil at saturation pressure, representing the volume change of oil under reservoir conditions.

SaturatedOilDensity.title: Saturated Oil Density
SaturatedOilDensity.description: The density of the oil at saturation pressure, used to calculate various fluid properties and reservoir conditions.

SeparatorTestGasOilRatio.title: Separator Test Gas Oil Ratio
SeparatorTestGasOilRatio.description: The ratio of gas to oil measured during the separator test, important for understanding the production characteristics.

OverallGasGravity.title: Overall Gas Gravity
OverallGasGravity.description: The average gravity of the gas, indicating its density relative to air and affecting the separation process.

Remarks.title: Remarks
Remarks.description: Additional notes or observations related to the multi-stage separator test.

RemarkSequenceNumber.title: Remark Sequence Number
RemarkSequenceNumber.description: A unique identifier for each remark record. This identifier is used to uniquely identify a member in an array of remarks.

Remark.title: Remark
Remark.description: A descriptive comment for this remark.

RemarkSource.title: Remark Source
RemarkSource.description: The person, vendor, interpreter or other provider of information.

RemarkDate.title: Remark Date
RemarkDate.description: The date the remark was issued.

TestSteps.title: Test Steps
TestSteps.description: Collection of data from various steps in the multi-stage separator test, providing detailed insights into the separation process.

items.title: Test Steps
items.description: Collection of data from various steps in the multi-stage separator test, providing detailed insights into the separation process.

StepNumber.title: Step Number
StepNumber.description: The step number in the multi-stage separator test, used to sequence and identify different phases of the test.

StepPressure.title: Step Pressure
StepPressure.description: The pressure applied during this step, affecting the separation efficiency and results.

StepTemperature.title: Step Temperature
StepTemperature.description: The temperature during this step of the test, influencing fluid properties and separation outcomes.

OilDensity.title: Oil Density
OilDensity.description: The density of the oil measured at this step, crucial for calculating volume factors and fluid behavior.

OilSpecificGravity.title: Oil Specific Gravity
OilSpecificGravity.description: The density of flashed oil relative to the density of water at 60 degrees Fahrenheit

ResidualOilAPIGravity.title: Residual Oil API Gravity
ResidualOilAPIGravity.description: The API gravity of the residual oil at the final test step conditions.

OilMolecularWeight.title: Oil Molecular Weight
OilMolecularWeight.description: The average molecular weight of the oil at this test step.

OilViscosity.title: Oil Viscosity
OilViscosity.description: A measure of a fluid’s internal resistance to flow.

OilFormationVolumeFactor.title: Oil Formation Volume Factor
OilFormationVolumeFactor.description: The formation volume factor of oil at this step, reflecting changes in oil volume under test conditions.

OilShrinkageFactor.title: Oil Shrinkage Factor
OilShrinkageFactor.description: This is inverse of stage oil formation volume factor, and commonly used instead of Oil Formation Volume Factor for intermediate stages

GasDensity.title: Gas Density
GasDensity.description: The density of the gas measured at a specific step, crucial for calculating volume factors and fluid behavior.

GasGravity.title: Gas Gravity
GasGravity.description: The gravity of the gas measured at this step, indicating its density and composition.

GasMolecularWeight.title: Gas Molecular Weight
GasMolecularWeight.description: The average molecular weight of the gas at this test step.

GasViscosity.title: Gas Viscosity
GasViscosity.description: A measure of a fluid’s internal resistance to flow.

GasZFactor.title: Gas Z Factor
GasZFactor.description: The compressibility factor of the gas, used to adjust gas volume measurements based on deviations from ideal gas behavior.

GasFormationVolumeFactor.title: Gas Formation Volume Factor
GasFormationVolumeFactor.description: The formation volume factor of the gas measured at a specific step, used to calculate gas volume changes.

CumulativeGasOilRatioLiberatedStandardCo.title: Cumulative Gas Oil Ratio Liberated Standard Conditions
CumulativeGasOilRatioLiberatedStandardCo.description: The cumulative liberated gas-to-oil ratio up to this step, referenced to standard conditions.

GasOilRatioStandardConditions.title: Gas Oil Ratio Standard Conditions
GasOilRatioStandardConditions.description: The volume of gas at standard conditions dissolved in the oil divided by the residual oil volume.

GasOilRatioStepConditions.title: Gas Oil Ratio Step Conditions
GasOilRatioStepConditions.description: The volume of gas at step conditions dissolved in the oil divided by the oil volume at this stage.

GasOilRatioLiberatedStandardConditions.title: Gas Oil Ratio Liberated Standard Conditions
GasOilRatioLiberatedStandardConditions.description: The volume of gas liberated at this step at standard conditions divided by the residual oil volume.

FluidConditions.title: Fluid Conditions
FluidConditions.description: Identifies the testing condition of the sample fluid, e.g. InitialReservoir, CurrentReservoir, StockTank, InitialSaturation (References SampleTestCondition).

PhasesPresentID.title: Phases Present ID
PhasesPresentID.description: Identifies the phases of fluid present in the sample, e.g. SeparatorLiquid, FlashedOil, OilWithMud, Gas, ReservoirFluid (references FluidPhasesPresent)

VaporComposition.title: Vapor Composition
VaporComposition.description: The detailed composition of the vapor phase, including the concentration of various components.

items.title: Vapor Composition
items.description: An array object capturing the composition of the vapor.

ComponentNameID.title: Component Name ID
ComponentNameID.description: Name of the component in the liquid.

RelativeMoleWeight.title: Relative Mole Weight
RelativeMoleWeight.description: Molar mass relative to other components.

MolecularWeight.title: Molecular Weight
MolecularWeight.description: The molecular weight of the component.

MolePercent.title: Mole Percent
MolePercent.description: The molar percentage of the component, if available.
MolePercent.x-osdu-frame-of-reference: UOM:amount of substance per amount of substance

MassPercent.title: Mass Percent
MassPercent.description: The mass percentage of the component, if available.

VolumePercent.title: Volume Percent
VolumePercent.description: The volume percentage of the component, if available.

SpecificGravity.title: Specific Gravity
SpecificGravity.description: The specific gravity of the component.

LiquidComposition.title: Liquid Composition
LiquidComposition.description: Array object capturing the composition of the liquid component of the sample at this test step.

items.title: Liquid Composition
items.description: An array object capturing the composition of the liquid.

ComponentNameID.title: Component Name ID
ComponentNameID.description: Name of the component in the liquid.

RelativeMoleWeight.title: Relative Mole Weight
RelativeMoleWeight.description: Molar mass relative to other components.

MolecularWeight.title: Molecular Weight
MolecularWeight.description: The molecular weight of the component.

MolePercent.title: Mole Percent
MolePercent.description: The molar percentage of the component, if available.
MolePercent.x-osdu-frame-of-reference: UOM:amount of substance per amount of substance

MassPercent.title: Mass Percent
MassPercent.description: The mass percentage of the component, if available.

VolumePercent.title: Volume Percent
VolumePercent.description: The volume percentage of the component, if available.

SpecificGravity.title: Specific Gravity
SpecificGravity.description: The specific gravity of the component.

Remarks.title: Remarks
Remarks.description: Array object capturing remarks or additional information for this test step.  Remarks for the analysis as a whole should be captured in the associated SamplesAnalysis work product component.

items.title: AbstractRemark
items.description: A remark object, pairing a remark text with a source, e.g. an author, and a date, which is typically included in an array. The RemarkSequenceNumber acts as unique key in this case.

RemarkSequenceNumber.title: Remark Sequence Number
RemarkSequenceNumber.description: A unique identifier for each remark record. This identifier is used to uniquely identify a member in an array of remarks.

Remark.title: Remark
Remark.description: A descriptive comment for this remark.

RemarkSource.title: Remark Source
RemarkSource.description: The person, vendor, interpreter or other provider of information.

RemarkDate.title: Remark Date
RemarkDate.description: The date the remark was issued.
